header: Fashion moves fast for young girls. They try on new clothes and discard old identities. They are eager to try new styles, but you can't be too forceful. With this in mind, we re-imagined the Francesca's website as a cool big sister to help these young shoppers navigate their early teen years.

layout.title: Time for a Refresh
text: When Francesca's came to us, their brand was stale. Their customers, mainly girls aged 11-15, had grown more sophisticated than when the company started in 2006. These girls now liked hipper brands like Madewell and ASOS. At the same time, we needed to make sure their parents didn't feel left out.
Francesca's wanted their website to to be cool, but not too edgy.

layout.title: The Strategy
text: Since these girls are still figuring out their fashion sense, we wanted to guide them, like an older sister would.

To do this, we created a way to browse that showed style ideas subtly, like flipping through a fashion magazine. When we shared this idea with our users, they loved it. So we designed a CMS for Francesca's editorial team to regularly update item pairings that worked well together.

Along with the site redesign, we worked hard to make Francesca's checkout process better. We came up with different designs for this and had users try them out. This helped us see which design worked best.
